text: you can see from this why they call them
twisters I can hear it a malevolent
force of nature barreling across the
horizon tearing up everything in its
path this is what happened after a
twister touched down near the town of
Little Rock Arkansas cutting across an
interstate freeway to create a path of
devastation 80 miles long rescue workers
have been going house-to-house in their
search for survivors this three year old
girl was found a hundred feet from her
home with a badly damaged hip but
several other children didn't make it
out alive after the tornado crushed cars
and reduced homes and businesses to
matchwood
no signs or anything went out there and
I felt the house shake a little bit and
I heard you know when what you would not
believe so I got up off my chair went
and looked out the front window hearing
about the time there we've seen the
twisting action right here all this
devastation here just coming up no
warning for some because the tornado
struck with such speed and such force
that it wiped out the early warning
sirens in one Oklahoma town while in
Arkansas a school set to open in August
was among the buildings reduced to ruins
President Obama sent his condolences to
the victims and has offered federal
assistance with the recovery effort but
more storms are expected in the Gulf
Coast and the Midwest in the next few
hours and the tornado season has only
just begun David Willis BBC News
Washington
